nginx.body: This directive concludes execution of the rules and returns the status code indicated to client. It is possible to use any http return code, ranging in number from 0-999. Furthermore, nonstandard code 444 closes the connection without sending any headers.

wikipedia.body: Used in Nginx logs to indicate that the server has returned no information to the client and closed the connection (useful as a deterrent for malware).

494.title: Request Header Too Large
494.summary: The request is larger than the server is willing or able to process

wikipedia.body: Internal code similar to 413 but it was introduced earlier.
Nginx internal code used when SSL client certificate error occurred to distinguish it from 4XX in a log and an error page redirection.
Nginx internal code used when client didn't provide certificate to distinguish it from 4XX in a log and an error page redirection.

497.title: HTTP to HTTPS
497.summary: http request sent to https port

wikipedia.body: Nginx internal code used for the plain HTTP requests that are sent to HTTPS port to distinguish it from 4XX in a log and an error page redirection
Used in Nginx logs to indicate when the connection has been closed by client while the server is still processing its request, making server unable to send a status code back
